com.itko.lisa.test

Class LisaException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • com.itko.lisa.test.LisaException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TestDefException, TestRunException

    public class LisaException
extends java.lang.Exception
    This exception class contains the base class for Lisa exceptions
    Version:
    1
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Parameters:
        node - - the currently running node when the exception occured
        detail - - human text describing the error
        caught - - if there was a non-LISA exception thrown, what was it

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Will create a human-readable (well, it's still an ugly Exception) string for display in windows or stream to the screen or whatever. Creates a box with ASCII chars around the thing, and displays nested exceptions as well.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Throwable
        Returns:
        String that explains the Exception

      • exceptionToString

        public static java.lang.String exceptionToString(java.lang.String header,
                                 java.lang.String node,
                                 java.lang.String detail,
                                 java.lang.Throwable caught)
        This is a utility method that will create the boxed-border style strings that are used by TestRunException and TestDefException. It will work for any Exception. If the Log has debug enabled, the stack trace will be displayed.
        Parameters:
        header - - used to display a message in the banner of the error message box
        node - - the TestNode, DataSet, or etc. name that has the error, or null if n/a
        detail - - a string that attempts to breifly describe the error
        caught - - if there is a nested exception, pass it here, or null
        Returns:
        a large String that is a displayable explanation of an Exception

      • exceptionToString

        public static java.lang.String exceptionToString(java.lang.String header,
                                 java.lang.String node,
                                 java.lang.String detail,
                                 java.lang.Throwable caught,
                                 boolean includeStackTrace)
        This is a utility method that will create the boxed-border style strings that are used by TestRunException and TestDefException. It will work for any Exception.
        Parameters:
        header - - used to display a message in the banner of the error message box
        node - - the TestNode, DataSet, or etc. name that has the error, or null if n/a
        detail - - a string that attempts to breifly describe the error
        caught - - if there is a nested exception, pass it here, or null
        includeStackTrace - - should the exception's stack trace be included?
        Returns:
        a large String that is a displayable explanation of an Exception
